definition: Caltrop or puncture vine (Tribulus terrestris)/to thatch (a roof)
an earthwork/castle/position of defense/stronghold/used in place names, often as phonetic bao for "burg" or "bad"
variant of 鋪|铺[pu4]/used in place names

sentences.english: Icicles hang from a roof in Lofer, Austrian province of Salzburg.
sentences.chinese: 在奥地利萨尔茨堡的劳弗尔，冰柱挂在屋顶上。

sentences.english: The name of Mozart is forever coupled with the city of Salzburg.
sentences.chinese: 莫扎特的名字永远与萨尔茨堡城联系在一起。

sentences.english: The state is split into two parts called North Tyrol and East Tyrol by the state of Salzburg.
sentences.chinese: 蒂罗尔州被萨尔茨堡州分成了两个部分。

definition: Nürnberg or Nuremberg, town in Bavaria, Germany
Dresden, capital of Saxony 薩克森州|萨克森州[Sa4 ke4 sen1 zhou1], Germany
Bruges (Dutch Brugge), medieval town in Belgium
Stuttgart city in southwest Germany and capital of Baden-Württemberg 巴登·符騰堡州|巴登·符腾堡州[Ba1 deng1 · Fu2 teng2 bao3 zhou1]
Leipzig, city in the state of Saxony, Germany
Copenhagen or København, capital of Denmark
Zagreb, capital of Croatia 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4]

pinyin: Bu4 la1 di2 si1 la1 fa1
